de.toman.milight

Class MilightColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.toman.milight.MilightColor

  • public class MilightColor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class extracts hue, saturation and brightness values from java.awt.Color instances and transforms them to values that can be sent to the Milight WiFi box.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The maximum brightness value to send to the WiFi box.

      The minimum color value to send to the WiFi box.
      static float SATURATION_THRESHOLD
      This threshold defines where the lights should change between white and colored mode.

    • Field Detail

      • MIN_COLOR

        public static final int MIN_COLOR
        The minimum color value to send to the WiFi box.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_COLOR

        public static final int MAX_COLOR
        The maximum color value to send to the WiFi box.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MIN_BRIGHTNESS

        public static final int MIN_BRIGHTNESS
        The minimum brightness value to send to the WiFi box. The documentation of the "LimitlessLED Technical Developer Opensource API" mentions that brightness values should be between 0x00 and 0x3B. However, in practice this does not hold. All available brightness levels are between 0x02 and 0x1B, outside this interval some arguments don't change the light at all, others give unexpected brightness values with the same result as the values between 0x02 and 0x1B.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_BRIGHTNESS

        public static final int MAX_BRIGHTNESS
        The maximum brightness value to send to the WiFi box. The documentation of the "LimitlessLED Technical Developer Opensource API" mentions that brightness values should be between 0x00 and 0x3B. However, in practice this does not hold. All available brightness levels are between 0x02 and 0x1B, outside this interval some arguments don't change the light at all, others give unexpected brightness values with the same result as the values between 0x02 and 0x1B.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SATURATION_THRESHOLD

        public static final float SATURATION_THRESHOLD
        This threshold defines where the lights should change between white and colored mode. All saturation values under the threshold will be displayed in white mode, everything equal or above in colored mode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MilightColor

        public MilightColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Use this constructor to generate a new MilightColor representing a specified color.
        Parameters:
        color - is the colorthe new instance should represent

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        This function returns the color the instance is representing.
        Returns:
        is the color the instance is representing

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Use this function to set the color the instance is representing.
        Parameters:
        color - is the color the instance should be representing

      • getHSB

        public float[] getHSB()
        This function extracts hue, saturation and brightness of the color the instance is representing. The values are returned as an array of size 3, each value is in the range betwen 0 and 1.
        Returns:
        is an array consisting of the hue, saturation and brightness values (in this order). All values are given in a range between 0 and 1
        See Also:
        Color.RGBtoHSB(int, int, int, float[])

      • getHue

        public float getHue()
        Extract the hue value from the color the instance is representing.
        Returns:
        the hue value in a range between 0 and 1
        See Also:
        Color.RGBtoHSB(int, int, int, float[])

      • setHue

        public void setHue(float hue)
        Set a new hue value and let the brightness and saturation values untouched.
        Parameters:
        hue - is the new hue value from 0 to 1

      • getSaturation

        public float getSaturation()
        Extract the saturation value from the color the instance is representing.
        Returns:
        the saturation value in a range between 0 and 1
        See Also:
        Color.RGBtoHSB(int, int, int, float[])

      • setSaturation

        public void setSaturation(float saturation)
        Set a new saturation value and let the brightness and hue values untouched.
        Parameters:
        saturation - is the new saturation value from 0 to 1

      • getBrightness

        public float getBrightness()
        Extract the brightness value from the color the instance is representing.
        Returns:
        the brightness value in a range between 0 and 1
        See Also:
        Color.RGBtoHSB(int, int, int, float[])

      • setBrightness

        public void setBrightness(float brightness)
        Set a new brightness value and let the hue and saturation values untouched.
        Parameters:
        brightness - is the new brightness value from 0 to 1

      • getMilightHue

        public int getMilightHue()
        This function extracts the hue value from the color the instance is representing and transforms it to a value that can be sent to the WiFi box. Therefore a linear change on the scale between 0 and 1 is applied setting 0 to 2/3, 1/3 to 1/3 and 2/3 to 0. Afterwards, the value is scaled to a maximum of MilightColor.MAX_COLOR.
        Returns:
        the hue value to send to the WiFi box

      • setMilightHue

        public void setMilightHue(int milightHue)
        This function sets a new hue value given as it would be sent to the WiFiBox. This function inverts the computation at getMilightHue().
        Parameters:
        milightHue - is the hue value to set, given as it would be sent to the WiFiBox

      • getMilightBrightness

        public int getMilightBrightness()
        This function extracts the brightness value from the color the instance is representing and transforms it to a value that can be sent to the WiFi box. Therefore the value is scaled to a scale between MilightColor.MIN_BRIGHTNESS and MilightColor.MAX_BRIGHTNESS.
        Returns:
        the brightness value to send to the WiFi box

      • setMilightBrightness

        public void setMilightBrightness(int milightBrightness)
        This function sets a new brightness value for the color the instance is representingThe value is given as it could be sent to the WiFiBox and internally transferred to a float. This reverses the computation of getMilightBrightness().
        Parameters:
        milightBrightness - is the brightness value to set, given as it would be sent to the WiFiBox

      • isWhiteMode

        public boolean isWhiteMode()
        This function computes whether a color should be displayed in white or colored mode. The white mode will be used if the saturation of the color is below SATURATION_THRESHOLD.
        Returns:
        true if the white mode should be used, false if the colored mode should be used

      • isColoredMode

        public boolean isColoredMode()
        This function computes whether a color should be displayed in white or colored mode. The white mode will be used if the saturation of the color is below SATURATION_THRESHOLD.
        Returns:
        true if the colored mode should be used, false if the white mode should be used

      • equals

        public boolean equals(MilightColor color)
        This function checks whether two MilightColors represent the same color by comparing their hsb values.
        Parameters:
        color - the color to compare to
        Returns:
        true if both MilightColors represent the same color, false otherwise

      • getTransition

        public MilightColor getTransition(MilightColor target,
                                  float x)
        This function finds colors between two MilightColors. By changing x from 0 to 1 the color will turn to the given one smoothly.
        Parameters:
        target - is the color to reach at x=1
        x - is the influence of the colors (x=0 returns this MilightColor, x=1 returns target)
        Returns:
        the newly created MilightColor between the given ones

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This function describes the objet as a string. Use this for debugging.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
